summary:
Abandoned shoes 
I had an idea to post a #phriday post on Fridays: a photo and my reflections on it.  Then I realized it doesn't have to be limited to just me. 
Everyone will have their own associations about the picture with the abandoned shoes...
title: Phriday: Let's Photo Reflect Together

summary: The proliferation of new top-level domains (TLDs) has exacerbated a well-known security weakness: Many organizations set up their internal Microsoft authentication systems years ago using domain names in TLDs that didn't exist at the time.  Meaning, they are continuously sending their Windows usernames and passwords to domain names they do not control and which are freely available for anyone to register.  Here's a look at one security researcher's efforts to map and shrink the size of this insidious problem
title: Local Networks Go Global When Domain Names Collide
